attributes.action: 2021 Use Teacher’s Assessment Grades or Predicted Grades For GCSE’s and A levels
attributes.additional_details:
In 2020 Government eventually announced that GCSE and A-level students will be given their Centre Assessment Grades (CAGs). 

This year Y11’s and Y13’s will sit exams having lost vital months of face to face teaching time.

Gavin Williamson has offered students an extra 3 weeks. This is not enough to catch up on valuable teaching time. Give students equity and the chance they deserve.
attributes.background: To change Standardisation Grading system to Teacher’s assessment grades or Predicted Grades For GCSE’s and A’levels in 2021

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Cancel GCSEs and A Levels in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326066

Base 2021 GCSE and A-Level Grades on Teacher Considerations and Mock Grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553307
